DOC.HEAD: Nearly $1 Million in Gold Taken By Gunmen in Jewelry District Robbery
DOC.TEXT: Two gunmen robbed a jewelry district wholesaler of nearly $1 million in gold Wednesday after handcuffing and tying up its two owners and five employees, police said. The robbers carried pistols and manhandled their captives, but the victims were not harmed. The gunmen, wearing surgical gloves, took the gold from an open safe, put it into a briefcase and made their getaway, the victims said. Khatchik Djigardjian, a co-owner of Rope Mine Corp. with his brother Liouduig, described the robbers as a tall, Irish-looking man who was silent and a short, bald man who spoke with an undetermined accent. The loot included at least 103 pounds of fine gold, gold chains, locks and scrap bars, Djigardjian said. An inventory would determine the exact loss, but it was ``close to a million dollars if not more than that,'' Djigardjian said. Gold closed at $406 per troy ounce in Zurich and $408.49 in Hong Kong on Wednesday. Police believe about 115 pounds of gold were taken, said Detective Manny Garcia. The detectives' report said both robbers may have been Middle Eastern. A Russian Armenian who emigrated to Lebanon and then came to the United States in 1974, Djigardjian said he has run a gold business in the building since 1976.
